guiSET.core

Class Textbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.Container
        • guiSET.core.HFlowContainer
          • guiSET.core.HScrollContainer
            • guiSET.core.Textbox
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PasswordTextbox

    public class Textbox
extends HScrollContainer
    A single-line Textbox that behaves just as you would expect one to behave. When focused (by click) text can be inserted via keyboard. Comes with expected features like cursor, selection, some keyboard shortcuts for cut/copy/paste, scrolling etc...
    Author:
    Mc-Zen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean submitOnEnter
      If submitOnEnter isn't set to false the return/enter key will trigger the submit-event and blur the focus on the textbox.

      • Fields inherited from class guiSET.core.Control

        BOTTOM_ANCHOR, FILL, FIT, FIT_INSIDE, LEFT_ANCHOR, name, RIGHT_ANCHOR, TOP_ANCHOR

      • pre

        public void pre()
        DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD. It is for internal purposes only and unfortunately needs to be public.

      • focus

        public void focus()
        Description copied from class: Control
        Request the Frame component to focus this object. The Frame decides upon the demand and can set this elements focused state to true. There can only be one focused element at a time and it is stored in the Frames focusedElement property.
        Overrides:
        focus in class Control
        See Also:
        focusedElement.

      • setSelectionStart

        public void setSelectionStart(int selectionStart)
        Set the start for the text selection. Selection start index can never be higher than end index.
        Parameters:
        selectionStart - selection start position

      • setSelectionEnd

        public void setSelectionEnd(int selectionEnd)
        Set the end for the text selection. Selection end index can never be less than start index.
        Parameters:
        selectionEnd - selection end position

      • setSelectionColor

        public void setSelectionColor(int selectionColor)

      • addKeyPressListener

        public void addKeyPressListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target)
        Add a key listener to the textbox. The event is triggered each time any key is pressed when the textbox has focus.
        Parameters:
        methodName - name of callback method
        target - object that declares callback method.

      • addKeyPressListener

        Parameters:

      • addSubmitListener

        public void addSubmitListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                              java.lang.Object target)
        So long as the property submitOnEnter is set to true, pressing enter or return will remove the focus of the textbox and call this event.
